oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Scene from "Wild River" shows "Garth Island" hands leaving as the water begins to rise
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A small water craft, flying an American flag, leads a fleet of six smaller boats past a cornfield.

The motion picture "Wild River" (1960) brought attention to the thousands of Tennesseans who had been forced to abandon their homes and land to make way for the Tennessee Valley Authority. Directed by Elia Kazan, the movie starred Lee Remick and Montgomery Clift. This movie still shows the Garth Island hands leaving as the lake begins to rise.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Motion pictures; Ferries; Rivers; Employees
